SENT.plain: Intracranial atherosclerotic disease accounts for 5-10% of ischemic strokes in the US
Lesions located in the anterior cerebral artery territory are infrequently reported
Patients in whom medical therapy fails are at a high risk for recurrent ischemic events, in which case intracranial angioplasty or stenting may be a reasonable therapy
There is a paucity of literature describing angioplasty of fixed atherosclerotic lesions affecting the anterior cerebral artery territory, and especially the A(2) segment
This case illustrates that this vessel segment may be treated with balloon angioplasty
